**Dragon Form** is a level 7 [Transmutations](/Transmutations "Transmutations") spell which transformed your character into a dragon, much like a [fire dragon](/Fire_dragon "Fire dragon").

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
  - [1.1 Draconians](#Draconians)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
  - [2.1 Tips & Tricks](#Tips_.26_Tricks)
- [3 History](#History)
- [4 References](#References)

## Useful Info

Casting this spell gives you Dragon Form for a spellpower-dependent duration. You'll gain the following:

**Combat**

- **HP Bonus:** +50%
- **Innate AC:** 16 AC [\[1\]](#cite_note-1)
- **[Unarmed Combat](/Unarmed_Combat "Unarmed Combat"):** 38 base damage (32 + 6 from [Claws](/Claws "Claws") 3)
- Two **[auxiliary attacks](/Auxiliary_attacks "Auxiliary attacks")**: Bite 5 (11 dmg) & Tail slap 3 (6 dmg).
- **[Breathe Fire](/Breathe_Fire "Breathe Fire"):** Active ability. Launch a piercing, range-5 bolt of fire, creating a [flame cloud](/Flame_cloud "Flame cloud") where it lands. No cost, but has a [cooldown](/Breath "Breath") of a few turns. Damage = `3d(4 + 2*XL/3)`.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)
- **Stat Bonus:** +10 [strength](/Strength "Strength").

**Resistances**

- [rF++](/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance")
- [rC-](/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance")
- [rPois](/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- Innate [flight](/Flight "Flight")

**Restrictions**

- **[Melded Gear](/Transformation#Useful_Info "Transformation"):** All [armour](/Armour "Armour"), [weapon](/Weapon "Weapon") and [shield](/Shield "Shield"). (only [rings](/Ring "Ring") and [amulet](/Amulet "Amulet") remain)
- **Other Restrictions:** Cannot [throw](/Throw "Throw").

**Other**

- Dragon Form is **[Giant](/Size#Giant "Size")**-sized. This gives a penalty to [EV](/EV "EV"), but you are resistant to [trampling](/Trample "Trample"), [constriction](/Constriction "Constriction"), and [nets](/Net "Net").
- Suppresses many mutations. Species [movement speed](/Movement_speed "Movement speed") set to 10.
- Claws 3 severs [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra") heads.

### Draconians

If you are a [Draconian](/Draconian "Draconian"), Dragon Form has special bonuses:

- The AC bonus from draconian scales is added to Dragon Form.
- You retain your natural [breath weapon](/Draconian_breath_weapon "Draconian breath weapon") (or lack thereof) instead of Breathe Fire. Additionally, your breath weapon is boosted in power.
- Instead of gaining rF++ and rC-, you retain your natural elemental resistances (or lack thereof). Red and white draconians gain rF++/rC- and rF-/rC++, respectively. You still get rPois, no matter the colour.

## Strategy

Dragon Form should be treated as the 'glass cannon' of Transmutation spells, much less durable than the +50% HP would make you think. The reduction to [EV](/EV "EV") from size, lack of [shield](/Shield "Shield"), loss of all [armour](/Armour "Armour") slots, and relatively low [AC](/AC "AC") (compared to [Statue Form](/Statue_Form "Statue Form") or a heavy armour character) seriously lowers your survivability. The vulnerability to [silver](/Silver "Silver") doesn't help things.

That being said: with 38 base damage, 2 [aux attacks](/Aux_attack "Aux attack"), and added strength, you hit like a truck. Using Dragon Form at 0 Unarmed skill means you hit harder than a character at 27 skill. Extra flame breaths don't hurt. Since Dragon Form is so strong at base, you don't need to train much UC to effectively fight in this spell. Overall, this spell can become a powerful killing tool, assuming you don't overestimate yourself.

### Tips & Tricks

- Unlike many other transmutations, Dragon Form does not impede spellcasting, beyond the inability to wield [staves](/Staves "Staves") or [Archmagi](/Archmagi "Archmagi"). You can use support spells or attack magically however you please.
  - Support magic, like [Ozocubu's Armour](/Ozocubu%27s_Armour "Ozocubu's Armour") or [Vhi's Electric Charge](/Vhi%27s_Electric_Charge "Vhi's Electric Charge"), can be very useful to have. Since you're using Unarmed Combat, [Manifold Assault](/Manifold_Assault "Manifold Assault") only hits 1/2 targets, but it can still be worth using.
- Don't forget about the fire breath, a free, moderately powerful ranged attack. It creates a [flame cloud](/Flame_cloud "Flame cloud") on landing; aim with **f .** to place the cloud on a specific enemy. Using flame breath at melee range means your enemy will be stuck inside the cloud for a while.
- If you can manage to get Dragon Form castable by the time you are ready to take on the various [Lair](/Lair "Lair") sub-branches, its ability to fly and resistance to poison can prove quite helpful. Just watch out for [silver](/Silver "Silver") [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") in [the Shoals](/The_Shoals "The Shoals") (and [Throw Icicle](/Throw_Icicle "Throw Icicle") from [aquamancers](/Merfolk_aquamancer "Merfolk aquamancer"), if you are vulnerable to cold).

## History

- Dragon Form was replaced with the [Dragon-blood talisman](/Dragon-blood_talisman "Dragon-blood talisman") in [0.31](/0.31 "0.31").
- Prior to [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), Dragon Form had Bite 3 (as Bite scaling was nerfed in this version). In addition, Breathe Fire was slightly weaker for non-Draconians (`3d(8 + XL/3)`).
- Prior to [0.27](/0.27 "0.27"), Dragon Form gave 34% [GDR](/GDR "GDR").
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), Dragon Form damage scaled with strength (`18 + 2 * str/3` damage, when including claws).
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), players in Dragon Form could [trample](/Trample "Trample") opponents.
- Prior to [0.13](/0.13 "0.13"), Dragon form was a Transmutation/Fire spell.
- Prior to [0.10](/0.10 "0.10"), draconians also received a +30% bonus to Dragon Form's [spell success](/Spell_success "Spell success") rate.
- Prior to [0.8](/0.8 "0.8"), draconians did not function differently.

Transforms the caster into a mighty, fire-breathing dragon. The caster becomes highly resistant to fire and resistant to poison, but vulnerable to cold. The caster becomes able to deal incredible damage in melee combat, and they become much more robust, although their evasiveness is reduced.

While transformed, any equipped weapons and armour are melded.

Dragon Form is a level 7 Transmutations spell which transformed your character into a dragon, much like a fire dragon.

Useful Info

Combat

  • HP Bonus: +50%
  • Innate AC: 16 AC [1]
  • Unarmed Combat: 38 base damage (32 + 6 from Claws 3)
  • Two auxiliary attacks: Bite 5 (11 dmg) & Tail slap 3 (6 dmg).
  • Breathe Fire: Active ability. Launch a piercing, range-5 bolt of fire, creating a flame cloud where it lands. No cost, but has a cooldown of a few turns. Damage = 3d(4 + 2*XL/3).[2][3]
  • Stat Bonus: +10 strength.

Resistances

  • rF++
  • rC-
  • rPois
  • Innate flight

Restrictions

  • Melded Gear: All armour, weapon and shield. (only rings and amulet remain)
  • Other Restrictions: Cannot throw.

  • Dragon Form is Giant-sized. This gives a penalty to EV, but you are resistant to trampling, constriction, and nets.
  • Suppresses many mutations. Species movement speed set to 10.
  • Claws 3 severs hydra heads.

Draconians

  • The AC bonus from draconian scales is added to Dragon Form.
  • You retain your natural breath weapon (or lack thereof) instead of Breathe Fire. Additionally, your breath weapon is boosted in power.

The vulnerability to silver doesn't help things.

That being said: with 38 base damage, 2 aux attacks, and added strength, you hit like a truck. Using Dragon Form at 0 Unarmed skill means you hit harder than a character at 27 skill. Extra flame breaths don't hurt. Since Dragon Form is so strong at base, you don't need to train much UC to effectively fight in this spell. Overall, this spell can become a powerful killing tool, assuming you don't overestimate yourself.

  • Unlike many other transmutations, Dragon Form does not impede spellcasting, beyond the inability to wield staves or Archmagi. You can use support spells or attack magically however you please.
    • Support magic, like Ozocubu's Armour or Vhi's Electric Charge, can be very useful to have. Since you're using Unarmed Combat, Manifold Assault only hits 1/2 targets, but it can still be worth using.
